key_points: The Virginia governor's race between Terry McAuliffe and Glenn Youngkin is viewed as a critical indicator for the 2022 midterms.
The race reflects the dueling goals of Democrats to frame it as a referendum on Trump, and Republicans to focus on Biden.
A notable surge in GOP poll watchers in Virginia is fueled by concerns over election integrity, echoing Trumpâ€™s unfounded claims of a rigged 2020 election.
Even though Glenn Youngkin has acknowledged Biden's legitimate win, Trump's allegations of election fraud mobilize GOP poll watcher volunteers.
Trump's ongoing claims of a stolen election inspire greater scrutiny and participation from Republican poll watchers.
Trump has explicitly encouraged his supporters to monitor polls, an action critics fear could lead to voter intimidation.
The increased focus on partisan poll watchers has raised concerns among election officials and voting rights activists.
Attempts to provide poll watchers with more autonomy and access have sparked a legislative push, alarming many observers.
Some election officials hope the influx of poll watchers might debunk conspiracy theories about election fraud.
There is concern that a pro-Trump volunteer surge aims more at voter intimidation than protecting electoral integrity.
spokespersons: Clara Belle Wheeler (former Virginia elections official)
